data.title: Poole, Urban, and javelin squad earn first points for Nevada; Senegal and George secure spots in final to highlight day one of the Mountain West Championships
data.meta_description: CLOVIS, Calif. – Emily Poole and Lilly Urban compiled a combined 16 points with their first and third place finishes in javelin, with the help of Hallee Hughes scoring
data.text:
CLOVIS, Calif. – Emily Poole and Lilly Urban compiled a combined 16 points with their first and third place finishes in javelin, with the help of Hallee Hughes scoring three and Izzy Steerman earning one point to put Nevada on the scoreboard with 20 points, while Halyn Senegal and Magdalene George earned spots in the 800 meters and 200 meters final to highlight day one of the Mountain West Championships in Clovis, California Friday afternoon. The Wolf Pack sit in third place at the conclusion of day one.

To kick things off for the Wolf Pack, the multis trio made up of Johanna Haas, Valeria Paez Rueda, and Kate Kadrmas competed in the first four events of the heptathlon. Haas came away with the highest place finishin the 100-meter hurdles in fifth with a time of 14.70. Paez Rueda was right behind her in sixth (14.77) and Kadrmas (15.34) was 12th.

Moving on to the high jump, Paez Rueda nearly reached a new personal record in the event, coming away with a mark of 1.63 meters to tie for fourth overall. Kadrmas (1.54m) and Haas (1.54m) earned 10th and 12th place finishes. At the end of the second event, the trio sat in fifth, 10th, and 13th respectively with Paez Rueda leading the way with 1,643 points.

Paez Rueda continued her momentum in the shot put, earning a new personal record mark of 11.28 meters, allowing her to place sixth overall. Haas was right behind her in seventh (11.23m) while Kadrmas rounded out the field in 12th (10.27m).

In the final event of the day in the heptathlon, Haas sped her way to a first-place finish in the 200 meters with a time of 25.46. Paez Rueda came in ninth (26.54) and Kadrmas was 15th (27.67). Heading into Saturday morning, the second and final day of the heptathlon, Paez Rueda sits in sixth with 3,008 points, Haas in seventh with 3,003 points, and Kadrmas in 14th with 2,667 points.

The javelin quad all earned a spot in the final of the event after their performances from their first three attempts. Leading the way was Lilly Urban, who bested her previous from the season, reaching a mark of 49.03 meters on her second attempt. With this distance, Urban jumped up on the Nevada all-time list to become fourth all-time. During the final, Emily Poole surpassed Urban's mark with a throw of 49.74 meters, then becoming third all-time and moving Urban down to fifth all-time. Poole's final throw broke her personal record for the second time of the afternoon, ending the day with a mark of 50.79 meters to take first overall in the event. This marks Poole's second career podium appearance (third place in 2022) and Mountain West medal. Urban would also come away with her first career podium finish, claiming third. Hallee Hughes (45.82m) scored three points and Izzy Steerman (42.84m) scored one for Nevada, finishing sixth and eighth overall.

Halyn Senegal secured a fifth-place finish in the 800-meter prelim to advance to the final Saturday with a time of 2:07.48. Kylee Denver finished 18th (2:14.69). Magdalene George, the Mountain West's top athlete in the 200 meters going into the championships, came away with a time of 23.51 to qualify fifth for the final of the event. Natasha Chetty and Bonét Henderson also represented the Pack in the event, placing 18th and 19th with times of 24.67 and 24.80 respectively.

Representing the Pack in the 400-meter hurdles was OkeOghene Ovedje, Kylie Burton, and Melia Middleton. Ovedje finished in 10th, just one spot out of making the final in the event, running a time of 1:01.20. Burton (1:02.33) finished 14th and Middleton (1:02.70) was 16th.

Paige Penrose was the lone wolf representing the Pack in the 10,000 meters where she finished 12th with a time of 37:13.50.

The Pack will be back in action tomorrow, beginning at 10:20 a.m. PT to wrap the final three events of the heptathlon. To stream all of Friday's events, visit www.themw.com/watch and for live results, visit the Mountain West Championship central page at https://themw.com/itrackchamp/
